articles.title: Eurogroup welcomes Bulgaria for the smooth introduction of the euro
articles.summary: Public support for the euro now permanently exceeds the share of its opponents, said the Bulgarian finance minister in resignation
articles.content:
BRUSSELS/SOFIA – The Eurogroup congratulates the Bulgarian authorities on the smooth process of introducing the euro, said the president of the group of euro area countries Kyriakos Pierrakakis at a press conference after the first meeting of the year of the finance ministers of the countries that have adopted the common European currency.

This was a historic moment for Bulgaria, which on January 1 became the newest country in the euro area, he added. The President of the Eurogroup noted that he had received from the caretaker Minister of Finance Temenuzhka Petkova a set of Bulgarian euro coins. Petkova represented Bulgaria for the first time as a full member of the Eurogroup at its regular meeting, held in the Belgian capital, after the country’s accession to the euro area.

The European Commissioner for Economic Affairs Valdis Dombrovskis said that the year is starting well and the introduction of the euro in Bulgaria marks a historic moment for the country, for the euro area and for the EU. This was the end of a difficult and long preparation and is the beginning of a new page full of opportunities, he added. The transition to the euro is a complex process. We welcome the smooth transition from the lev to the euro; this is due to the extensive technical preparation and the information campaign undertaken by the Bulgarian authorities, the Commissioner said.

The caretaker Minister of Finance Temenuzhka Petkova said, quoted by the ministry’s press office, that through nearly two thousand information events and meetings for different target groups across the country, the level of awareness of the process of Bulgaria’s accession to the euro area has reached about 80%, and public support for the euro now consistently exceeds the share of opponents of the single currency. According to Petkova, Bulgaria’s transition to the single European currency is proceeding successfully, and all key systems are functioning normally – cash circulation is ensured, payments are being made without interruption, payment systems are operating stably, and the administration, businesses and citizens are adapting without significant difficulties.

Among the current priorities of state institutions, the caretaker finance minister highlighted consumer protection. Dual price display will continue until August 2026, and the period of dual circulation of the lev and the euro lasts until the end of January. According to data presented at the meeting, at the moment over 4.3 billion euro have been put into circulation, and nearly 60 percent of the levs in circulation have already been withdrawn. (19 January)
articles.reasoning: The article reports a significant economic milestone with Bulgaria's successful adoption of the euro, marking a historic moment that brings broad benefits to the country and the EU. The smooth transition, high public support, and effective preparation indicate a positive real-world impact with meaningful scope and sufficient detail.
articles.personality_title: Bulgaria joins the eurozone with smooth transition and strong public support
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context** – Bulgaria became the newest member of the eurozone on January 1, replacing its national currency, the lev, with the euro. Joining the eurozone means Bulgaria now uses the common European currency shared by many EU countries.

**What happened** – The Eurogroup, a group of finance ministers from eurozone countries, praised Bulgaria for a smooth changeover to the euro. Bulgaria’s caretaker Finance Minister Temenuzhka Petkova attended her first Eurogroup meeting representing Bulgaria as a full member. Over 4.3 billion euros are now in circulation, and nearly 60% of levs have been taken out of use. The government held about 2,000 events to inform the public, reaching 80% awareness and gaining more supporters than opponents of the euro.

**Impact** – This change is important because it shows Bulgaria successfully joined a major economic group without problems. The public’s strong support and the careful planning helped avoid confusion or disruptions. Payments and banking systems are working well, and prices will be shown in both lev and euros until August 2026 to protect consumers.

**What’s next step** – Bulgaria will continue monitoring the transition, especially consumer protection during the dual price display period. The lev and euro will both be accepted until the end of January, after which the euro will be the only official currency. This new membership opens opportunities for Bulgaria to participate more fully in the European economy.

**One-sentence takeaway** – Bulgaria’s smooth switch to the euro marks a historic step with strong public backing and careful planning ensuring a successful start in the eurozone.
articles.personality_title_fr: La Bulgarie rejoint la zone euro avec une transition réussie et un fort soutien public
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte** – La Bulgarie est devenue le plus récent membre de la zone euro le 1er janvier, remplaçant sa monnaie nationale, le lev, par l’euro. Rejoindre la zone euro signifie que la Bulgarie utilise désormais la monnaie commune européenne partagée par de nombreux pays de l’UE.

**Ce qui s’est passé** – L’Eurogroupe, un groupe de ministres des finances des pays de la zone euro, a félicité la Bulgarie pour une transition fluide vers l’euro. La ministre des Finances par intérim, Temenuzhka Petkova, a assisté à sa première réunion de l’Eurogroupe en tant que membre à part entière. Plus de 4,3 milliards d’euros sont maintenant en circulation, et près de 60 % des levs ont été retirés de la circulation. Le gouvernement a organisé environ 2 000 événements pour informer le public, atteignant 80 % de sensibilisation et gagnant plus de partisans que d’opposants à l’euro.

**Impact** – Ce changement est important car il montre que la Bulgarie a rejoint un grand groupe économique sans problèmes. Le fort soutien du public et la planification soigneuse ont évité toute confusion ou perturbation. Les paiements et les systèmes bancaires fonctionnent bien, et les prix seront affichés en lev et en euro jusqu’en août 2026 pour protéger les consommateurs.

**Prochaine étape** – La Bulgarie continuera de suivre la transition, en particulier la protection des consommateurs pendant la période d’affichage des prix en double. Le lev et l’euro seront acceptés jusqu’à la fin janvier, après quoi l’euro sera la seule monnaie officielle. Cette nouvelle adhésion ouvre des opportunités pour que la Bulgarie participe davantage à l’économie européenne.

**En résumé** – Le passage réussi de la Bulgarie à l’euro marque une étape historique avec un fort soutien public et une planification attentive assurant un départ réussi dans la zone euro.
articles.personality_title_es: Bulgaria se une a la zona euro con una transición suave y fuerte apoyo público
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto** – Bulgaria se convirtió en el miembro más reciente de la zona euro el 1 de enero, reemplazando su moneda nacional, el lev, por el euro. Unirse a la zona euro significa que Bulgaria ahora usa la moneda común europea compartida por muchos países de la UE.

**Qué pasó** – El Eurogrupo, un grupo de ministros de finanzas de los países de la zona euro, elogió a Bulgaria por una transición sin problemas al euro. La ministra de Finanzas interina, Temenuzhka Petkova, asistió a su primera reunión del Eurogrupo como miembro pleno. Más de 4.3 mil millones de euros ya están en circulación y casi el 60 % de los levs han sido retirados. El gobierno realizó cerca de 2,000 eventos para informar al público, alcanzando un 80 % de conocimiento y ganando más partidarios que opositores al euro.

**Impacto** – Este cambio es importante porque muestra que Bulgaria se unió a un gran grupo económico sin problemas. El fuerte apoyo público y la planificación cuidadosa ayudaron a evitar confusiones o interrupciones. Los pagos y sistemas bancarios funcionan bien, y los precios se mostrarán en lev y euros hasta agosto de 2026 para proteger a los consumidores.

**Próximo paso** – Bulgaria continuará monitoreando la transición, especialmente la protección al consumidor durante el período de doble exhibición de precios. El lev y el euro se aceptarán hasta finales de enero, después de lo cual el euro será la única moneda oficial. Esta nueva membresía abre oportunidades para que Bulgaria participe más plenamente en la economía europea.

**Conclusión en una frase** – La transición suave de Bulgaria al euro marca un paso histórico con fuerte apoyo público y planificación cuidadosa que asegura un comienzo exitoso en la zona euro.

articles.title: Cow astonishes scientists with rare use of tools
articles.summary: The discovery suggests cows may have far greater cognitive abilities than previously assumed.
articles.content:
Cow astonishes scientists with rare use of tools

14 hours ago Share Save Share Save

Watch: Veronika the cow shows off her unique skills

Scientists are rethinking what cattle are capable of after an Austrian cow named Veronika was found to use tools with impressive skill. The discovery, reported by researchers in Vienna, suggests cows may have far greater cognitive abilities than previously assumed. Veronika, a cow living in a mountain village in the Austrian countryside, has spent years perfecting the art of scratching herself using sticks, rakes, and brooms. Word of her behaviour eventually reached animal intelligence specialists in Vienna, who found Veronika used both ends of the same object for different tasks.

Antonio J Osuna Mascaró Veronika, a Swiss brown cow living in Austria

If it were her back or another tough area that warranted a good scratch, she would use the bristle end of a broom. When a softer touch was needed, such as on her sensitive underbelly, she would use the smooth handle end. This kind of tool use is rarely seen in the animal kingdom and has never been documented in cattle before. Dr Antonio Osuna-Mascaro of the University of Veterinary Medicine in Vienna said: "We were not expecting cows to be able to use tools, and we were not expecting a cow to use a tool as a multipurpose tool. Until now this has only been consistently reported in chimpanzees."

Getty Images Chimpanzees show sophisticated tool use, such as using a stick to get fruit from a box
articles.reasoning: The article reports a significant scientific discovery about animal cognition, revealing that cows can use tools in a sophisticated way previously undocumented. This challenges existing assumptions about cattle intelligence and expands understanding of animal behavior, which has broad implications for animal welfare and science.
articles.personality_title: Austrian cow surprises scientists by using tools in new ways
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context** – Scientists have long thought cows were simple animals without advanced thinking skills. Tool use, like using objects to help with tasks, is usually seen in smart animals like chimpanzees.

**What happened** – In a village in Austria, a cow named Veronika showed she could use sticks, rakes, and brooms to scratch herself. She even used both ends of a broom differently: the bristles to scratch hard-to-reach spots and the smooth handle for gentle areas like her belly. Researchers from the University of Veterinary Medicine in Vienna studied her behavior and confirmed this skill.

**Impact** – This is the first time scientists have seen cows use tools this way. It shows cows might be smarter than people thought. Understanding this helps improve how we treat and care for cows and changes how scientists study animal intelligence.

**What's next step** – Researchers will likely study other cows to see if tool use is common and learn more about how cows think. This could lead to better ways to care for them and new ideas about animal intelligence.

**One-sentence takeaway** – An Austrian cow named Veronika has shown that cows can use tools in clever ways, challenging what we know about their intelligence.
articles.personality_title_fr: Une vache autrichienne étonne les scientifiques en utilisant des outils de manière nouvelle
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte** – Les scientifiques pensaient que les vaches n'avaient pas de capacités de réflexion avancées. L'utilisation d'outils, c’est-à-dire utiliser des objets pour aider dans des tâches, est généralement observée chez des animaux intelligents comme les chimpanzés.

**Ce qui s’est passé** – Dans un village d’Autriche, une vache nommée Veronika a montré qu’elle pouvait utiliser des bâtons, des râteaux et des balais pour se gratter. Elle utilisait même les deux extrémités d’un balai différemment : les poils pour se gratter les zones difficiles d’accès et le manche lisse pour les parties sensibles comme son ventre. Des chercheurs de l’Université de médecine vétérinaire de Vienne ont étudié son comportement et confirmé cette capacité.

**Impact** – C’est la première fois que des scientifiques voient des vaches utiliser des outils de cette manière. Cela montre que les vaches pourraient être plus intelligentes qu’on ne le pensait. Mieux comprendre cela aide à améliorer leur traitement et change la manière dont les scientifiques étudient l’intelligence animale.

**Prochaine étape** – Les chercheurs vont probablement étudier d’autres vaches pour savoir si l’usage d’outils est courant et mieux comprendre leur façon de penser. Cela pourrait conduire à de meilleures méthodes de soin et à de nouvelles idées sur l’intelligence animale.

**En une phrase** – Une vache autrichienne nommée Veronika a montré que les vaches peuvent utiliser des outils de façon intelligente, remettant en question ce que l’on sait de leur intelligence.
articles.personality_title_es: Una vaca austriaca sorprende a los científicos usando herramientas de nuevas formas
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto** – Los científicos creían que las vacas no tenían habilidades avanzadas de pensamiento. El uso de herramientas, que significa usar objetos para ayudar en tareas, generalmente se ve en animales inteligentes como los chimpancés.

**Qué pasó** – En un pueblo de Austria, una vaca llamada Veronika mostró que podía usar palos, rastrillos y escobas para rascarse. Incluso usaba ambos extremos de una escoba de manera diferente: las cerdas para rascar zonas difíciles y el mango liso para áreas sensibles como su barriga. Investigadores de la Universidad de Medicina Veterinaria de Viena estudiaron su comportamiento y confirmaron esta habilidad.

**Impacto** – Es la primera vez que los científicos ven a una vaca usar herramientas de esta manera. Esto muestra que las vacas podrían ser más inteligentes de lo que se pensaba. Entender esto ayuda a mejorar cómo cuidamos a las vacas y cambia la forma en que los científicos estudian la inteligencia animal.

**Próximo paso** – Los investigadores probablemente estudiarán a otras vacas para ver si el uso de herramientas es común y aprender más sobre cómo piensan. Esto podría llevar a mejores formas de cuidarlas y nuevas ideas sobre la inteligencia animal.

**Una frase clave** – Una vaca austriaca llamada Veronika ha demostrado que las vacas pueden usar herramientas de manera inteligente, desafiando lo que se sabe sobre su inteligencia.
